line-description: Downtown LA - Westwood via Sunset Bl
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Downtown LA - Santa Monica via Santa Monica Bl
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: West Hollywood - Downtown LA via Melrose Av
card-1: Owl service discontinued due to low ridership.
card-2:
• No route changes.
  • Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: Beverly Center - Downtown LA via Beverly Bl
card-2:
• No route changes to Line 14 between downtown LA and Beverly/San Vicente via Beverly Bl.
  • New Line 617 provides service west of Beverly/San Vicente to Pico Bl via Beverly Dr.
  • Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: Downtown LA - West Hollywood via West 3rd St
card-1:
• Lines 16 and 17 merge to become the new Line 16, which operates via Line 16/17 normal route between downtown LA and 3rd St/San Vicente via 3rd St, then north on San Vicente to Santa Monica Bl.
  • Line 16 west of 3rd St/San Vicente on Burton Way in Beverly Hills is replaced by new Line 617, which operates from E Line (Expo) Culver City Station to Cedars-Sinai Medical Center/Beverly Center via Robertson Bl (replacing Line 17), then west on Burton Way and Beverly Dr to Pico Bl.
card-2: Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.
card-3: More weekday trips. New weekend service for Robertson Bl.

line-description: Downtown LA - 3rd St - Robertson Bl
card-1:
• Line 17 merged with the new Line 16, which operates via Line 16/17 normal route between downtown LA and 3rd St/San Vicente via 3rd St, then north on San Vicente to Santa Monica Bl.
  • Line 16 west of 3rd St/San Vicente on Burton Way in Beverly Hills is replaced by new Line 617, which operates from E Line (Expo) Culver City Station to Cedars-Sinai Medical Center/Beverly Center via Robertson Bl (replacing Line 17), then west on Burton Way and Beverly Dr to Pico Bl.
card-2: Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: Wilshire Western Station - Montebello Metrolink Station via 6th St & Whittier Bl
card-1: Line 18 replaces Line 720 east of downtown LA.
card-2:
• No route changes to Line 18 between Montebello/Commerce Metrolink station.
  • Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.
card-3: More weekday and weekend trips. Increased service east of downtown LA to East LA/Commerce Center via Whittier Bl.

line-description: Downtown LA - Westwood/Santa Monica via Wilshire Bl
card-2:
• Westbound route changes to travel via Wall St, right 7th St, right Los Angeles St, left 5th St then operates via normal route.
  • No changes to eastbound route.

line-description: Century City - Downtown LA via Olympic Bl
card-1:
• Line 45 serves the discontinued section of Line 28 on Broadway between downtown LA (Cesar Chavez Av) and Ave 26.
  • Line 251 will extend trips every 30 min. weekdays and weekends to link Broadway, L Line(Gold) Lincoln/Cypress Station and Eagle Rock via existing Line 28 route on Eagle Rock Bl.
card-2: Line 28 operates via normal route between Century City and downtown LA, and terminates at Cesar Chavez/Vignes via Olympic Bl.

line-description: West Hollywood - Downtown LA - Indiana Station via Pico Bl & 1st St
card-1: Service is discontinued on San Vicente Av between West Hollywood and Pico Rimpau Transit Center; high frequency north-south lines (204, 207, 210) and east-west lines (4, 14, 16, 20, 28, 720) are available as alternative services.
card-2: Operates via existing route between Pico Rimpau Transit Center and 1st St in downtown LA, with trips ending at either Union Station or continuing east to Indiana Station via normal route.

line-description: Downtown LA - Santa Monica via Venice Bl
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Downtown LA - Washington/Fairfax via Washington Bl
card-2:
• No route changes.
  • Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: Downtown LA - Washington/Fairfax via Adams Bl
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Downtown LA - Washington/Fairfax via Jefferson Bl
card-2:
• No route changes.
  • Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: Downtown LA - South Bay Galleria via ML King Bl-Hawthorne Bl
card-2: Route change in downtown LA to travel via Los Angeles St between Alameda St and 1st St to avoid Regional Connector construction.

line-description: Lincoln Heights - Downtown LA - Harbor Freeway Station via Broadway
card-1: Line 127 extends from A Line (Blue) Compton Station to replace Line 45 segment south of Harbor Freeway Station (Figueroa/117th St) via Imperial Hwy, Broadway, El Segundo Bl, Main St, Rosecrans Av, Avalon Bl and Compton Bl.
card-2: Line 45 is altered to follow route between C Line (Green)/J Line (Silver) Harbor Freeway Station, downtown LA and Lincoln Heights via Broadway.

line-description: Downtown LA - Avalon Station via Main St
card-2:
• No route changes.
  • Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: Wilshire Center - Downtown LA - CSU University Dominguez Hills via 7th St & Avalon Bl
card-1:
• Lines 51 and 52 merge to become the new Line 51, which operates from Wilshire/Vermont via the existing route on 7th St to downtown LA and San Pedro St and Avalon Bl to the C Line (Green) Avalon Station.
  • An extension of Line 127 replaces Line 51 on Compton Bl and provides a new link to the J Line (Silver)/C Line Harbor Freeway Station, replacing Line 52 trips to Harbor Gateway Transit Center.
card-2:
• Some Line 51 trips extend south on Avalon Bl to terminate at Victoria St/Tamcliff Av at Cal State Dominguez Hills campus, traveling north via right Central Av, right University Dr, right Avalon Bl.
  • Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: Wilshire Center - Downtown LA - Harbor Gateway Transit Center via 7th St & Avalon Bl
card-1:
• Line 52 merged into the new Line 51, which operates from Wilshire/Vermont via the existing route on 7th St to downtown LA and San Pedro St and Avalon Bl to the C Line (Green) Avalon Station.
  • An extension of Line 127 replaces Line 51 on Compton Bl and provides a new link to the J Line (Silver)/C Line Harbor Freeway Station, replacing Line 52 trips to Harbor Gateway Transit Center.
  • Take Metro lines 205 or 246, Torrance Transit lines 6 or 13 between Carson and the Harbor Gateway Transit Center.
card-2:
• Selected Line 51 trips extend south on Avalon Bl to terminate at Victoria St/Tamcliff Av at Cal State Dominguez Hills campus, traveling north via right Central Av, right University Dr, right Avalon Bl.
  • Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: Downtown LA - CSU Dominguez Hills via Central Av
card-2:
• No route changes.
  • Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: Downtown LA - Willowbrook Station via Compton Av
card-2:
• No route changes.
  • Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: Downtown LA - Artesia Station via Long Beach Bl
card-2: Route change in downtown LA to provide more service for the east end of 7th St; operates both directions via Los Angeles and 7th Sts between 5th/6th Sts and Central Av.

line-description: Downtown LA - Hawaiian Gardens via Telegraph Rd
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Wilshire Center - Downtown LA - Montebello via 8th St - Olympic Bl
card-2:
• Route changes to operate the existing alignment between Wilshire/Western Station and Montebello/Commerce Metrolink Station via Western Av, 8th St, and Olympic Bl/8th St.
  • Line 66 eastern terminus will be Commerce Center for every other trip daytime and all trips all week after 8pm, eastbound route via Olympic Bl, left Goodrich St, returning westbound via right Whittier Bl, right Gerhart St, right Olympic Bl.

line-description: Downtown LA - The Shops at Montebello via Cesar Chavez Av
card-1:
• Line 68 is discontinued.
  • Service along Cesar Chavez Av is replaced by a more frequent Line 70.
  • Service east of Atlantic Bl to the Shops of Montebello is replaced by Line 106 extension.

line-description: Downtown LA - El Monte via Cesar Chavez Av/Atlantic Bl/Garvey Av
card-1:
• Line 70 merges with Lines 68 and 770 to become the new Line 70.
  • Lines 68 and 770 are discontinued.
  • Line 70 segment from CSULA to Garvey/ Atlantic is replaced by extension of Line 106.
card-3:
• More weekday and weekend service.
  • More Owl service, operating via Line 770 routing between downtown LA and El Monte Station via Cesar Chavez Av, Atlantic Bl and Garvey Av.

line-description: Downtown LA - CSU LA - LAC+USC Med Center
card-1:
• Line 71 is discontinued.
  • Service from Marengo St/State St is replaced by Line 106 extension to CSU Los Angeles Transit Center.
  • Lines 78 and 79 provide service to downtown LA from Mission Rd/Marengo St.

line-description: Downtown LA - El Monte via Valley Bl
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Downtown LA - Arcadia via Las Tunas/Huntington Drs
card-2: Line 78 east end will terminate at Live Oak Av/Santa Anita Av. Foothill Transit 492 provides alternative service on Live Oak Av east of Santa Anita Av.

line-description: Downtown LA - Arcadia via Las Tunas/Huntington Drs
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Eagle Rock - Downtown LA - Harbor Freeway Station via Figueroa St
card-2:
• Route remains the same south of Figueroa St and Yosemite Dr via Figueroa St to downtown LA and the J Line (Silver)/C Line (Green) Harbor Freeway Station.
  • Line 81 replaces Line 181 in Eagle Rock with a change in route via Yosemite St to Colorado Bl/Eagledale. Other trips will continue to end at Figueroa/Colorado.
  • Line 81 overnight Owl service replaces Line 83 Owl service from downtown LA to Figueroa/Colorado and connects to Line 180 Owl.

line-description: Downtown LA - Eagle Rock via  York Bl
card-1:
• Line 83 is discontinued.
  • Line 182 replaces Line 83 service on York Bl between Figueroa St and Eagle Rock Bl.
  • Line 81 and the L Line (Gold) provide alternative service from downtown LA to Highland Park.
  • Metro Micro on-demand service is available in Highland Park/Eagle Rock.
  • Line 81 overnight Owl service replaces Line 83 Owl service from downtown LA to Figueroa/Colorado and connects to Line 180 Owl.

line-description: LA Civic Center - Sunland - North Hollywood via Glendale Av-Foothill Bl-Vineland Av
card-1:
• Lines 90 and 91 merge to become the new Line 90 between downtown LA (1st St) and Sunland, then extends via Vineland Av to B Line (Red) North Hollywood Station.
  • New Line 690 operates between Sunland and Olive View Medical Center via Foothill Bl, continuing to Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station replacing a segment of Line 224.
  • Service on Honolulu St in Glendale/La Crescenta is discontinued due to low ridership.
  • Frequent Line 94 continues to serve downtown LA (Hill St) south of 1st St in place of Lines 90 and 91.

line-description: Downtown LA - Sunland
card-1:
• Line 91 merged into the new Line 90 between downtown LA (1st St) and Sunland, then extend via Vineland Av to B Line (Red) North Hollywood Station.
  • New Line 690 operates between Sunland and Olive View Medical Center via Foothill Bl, continuing to Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station replacing a segment of Line 224.
  • Service on Honolulu St in Glendale/La Crescenta is discontinued due to low ridership.
  • Frequent Line 94 continues to serve downtown LA (Hill St) south of 1st St in place of Lines 90 and 91.

line-description: Downtown LA - Sylmar Station via Glendale-Glenoaks Bl
card-2:
• No route changes.
  • Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: Downtown LA - Glendale - Burbank - North Hollywood via San Fernando Rd and Magnolia Bl
card-1:
• Lines 94 and 794 merge to become more frequent Line 94 that operates on San Fernando Rd via most of Line 94 normal route between downtown LA and downtown Burbank.
  • New Line 294 operates on San Fernando Rd between Sylmar San Fernando Metrolink Station and downtown Burbank in place of Lines 94 and 794.
card-2:
• Route changes to operate through downtown Glendale via Brand Bl and Broadway (instead of direct via San Fernando Rd).
  • Line 94 adds a new extension via Magnolia Bl between Burbank and B Line (Red) North Hollywood Station, which replaces a segment of Line 183.
  • Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: Chinatown - Burbank Station via Griffith Park Dr
card-2:
• Line 96 operates via normal route between downtown Burbank, LA Zoo, Elysian Valley (Riverside Dr) and Chinatown, terminating at Main and Alameda.
  • Line 94 provides service on Hill St for travel further into downtown LA.

line-description: LAX City Bus Center - South Gate via La Tijera-Exposition Blvds
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: West Hollywood - Vernon via La Cienega Bl/Vernon Av
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Atlantic/Garvey- Cal State LA - LAC USC Medical Center- ELAC-Shops at Montebello
card-2:
• Route is extended from Atlantic/Cesar Chavez to The Shops at Montebello via the former Line 68 route.
  • Line 106 also extends from State St and Marengo St via Line 71 route, and then extends via the existing Line 70 route to Garvey Av and Atlantic Bl.
  • Line 106 route is also changed to provide direct service to the L Line (Gold) Atlantic Station, then travels direct via 1st St to State St instead of traveling via Indiana St, 3rd St, 4th St, Soto St, Whittier Bl, and Boyle Av.
card-3: More weekday trips. New weekend service.

line-description: Marina Del Rey - Pico Rivera via Slauson Av
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Playa Vista - Bell Gardens via Jefferson Bl-Gage Av
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: LAX City Bus Center - Norwalk Station via Florence Av
card-2:
• No route changes.

card-3: More weekday trips - extended further west to Inglewood Transit Center.

line-description: Playa Del Rey - Norwalk via Manchester Av - Firestone Bl
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: LAX City Bus Center - Downey via Century Bl-Imperial Hwy
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Aviation/LAX Station - Whittwood Center via Imperial Hwy
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: El Segundo - Norwalk Station via Rosecrans Av
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Compton Station - Downey via Compton-Somerset Bl
card-2:
• Operates via normal route between Downey Depot and A Line (Blue) Compton Station.
  • Extends west of A Line Compton Station to J Line (Silver)/C Line (Green) Harbor Freeway Station via Compton Bl, Avalon Bl, Rosecrans Av, Main St, El Segundo Bl, Broadway, and Imperial Hwy to Figueroa/117th St, replacing segments of Lines 45 and 51.
card-3: More weekday trips. New weekend service.

line-description: Compton Station - Cerritos Towne Center via Alondra Bl
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Redondo Beach - Los Cerritos Center via Artesia Bl
card-2:
• Line 130 operates via normal route on Artesia Bl between A Line (Blue) Artesia Station and Cerritos.
  • Torrance Transit new Line 13 replaces Line 130 west of the A Line Artesia Station, and follows the former Line 130 route via Artesia Bl to Redondo Beach.

line-description: Chatsworth - Canoga Park - Tarzana via Topanga Canyon Bl-Ventura Bl
card-1:
• Lines 150, 240, 245, 744 and 750 merge to create new Lines 150 and 240.
  • Line 150 operates from Ventura/Reseda west to Chatsworth Station along Ventura Bl and Topanga Canyon Bl.
  • New Line 150 replaces Line 245 on Topanga Canyon Bl and Line 750 on Ventura Bl west of Reseda Bl.
  • Line 240 operates via Reseda Bl and east along Ventura Bl between Northridge (Devonshire St), CSUN campus and B Line (Red) Universal City/Studio City Station.
  • New Line 240 replaces Lines 150, 744 and 750 on Ventura Bl east of Ventura/Reseda and replaces Line 744 on Reseda Bl.

line-description: Topanga Canyon Bl - North Hollywood Station via Roscoe Bl
card-2:
• Route changes to operate via Lankershim Bl for a more direct connection to the B Line (Red) North Hollywood Station.
  • West end terminus is at Roscoe Bl/Topanga Canyon Bl, with connection available to G Line (Orange) and Line 150 service to Canoga Park area.
  • Service on Vineland Ave is provided by modified Lines 90 and 162.
  • On Fallbrook Av, Line 162 replaces Line 152.

line-description: Sepulveda Bl - Burbank Station via Oxnard St-Burbank Bl
card-2:
• Continues to operate via normal route between downtown Burbank and the B Line (Red) North Hollywood Station via Burbank Bl and Edison Av/Oxnard St, and west of North Hollywood Station to Sepulveda Bl.
  • Line 154 west of Sepulveda Bl is discontinued due to low ridership; alternative service is available on Line 164 on Victory Bl and the G Line (Orange) service.

line-description: Sherman Oaks - Burbank Station via Riverside Dr-Olive St
card-2:
• Continues to operate via normal route between downtown Burbank, the B Line (Red) Universal City/Studio City Station and Van Nuys Bl via Olive Av and Riverside Dr.
  • Line 155 is extended from Van Nuys Bl via Sepulveda Bl and via Magnolia Bl to the North Hollywood B Line (Red) Station, replacing Line 183 on this segment.

line-description: Chatsworth Station - Sherman Oaks via Devonshire-Woodman
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Thousand Oaks - Agoura Hills - Calbasas - Warner Center
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Woodland Hills - West Hills - North Hollywood via Sherman Way-Vineland Av
card-1:
• Lines 162 and 163 merge to become the new Line 162, with frequent service on Sherman Way.
  • On the east end, Line 162 operates via Vineland Av to provide connection to the B Line (Red) North Hollywood Station.
  • On the west end, Line 162 operates via Fallbrook Av, replacing Line 152, with direct service to West Hills Medical Center.
  • Line 152 replaces Line 162 service on Lankershim Bl.

line-description: Woodland Hills - West Hills - North Hollywood via Sherman Way
card-1:
• Line 163 merged into the new Line 162, with frequent service on Sherman Way.
  • On the east end, Line 162 operates via Vineland Av to provide connection to the B Line (Red) North Hollywood Station, and will operate via Fallbrook Av at the west end of the line (replacing Line 152), with direct service to West Hills Medical Center.
  • Line 152 replaces Line 162 service on Lankershim Bl.

line-description: West Hills - Burbank via Victory Bl
card-2:
• No route changes.
  • Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: West Hills - Burbank via Vanowen St
card-2:
• No route changes.
  • Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: Canoga Av - Sun Valley via Nordhoff St-Osborne St
card-2:
• Line 166 continues to operate via Nordhoff St and Osborne St.
  • On the west end, route terminates at Nordhoff St/Canoga Av, connecting with G Line (Orange).
  • The segment on Topanga Canyon Bl is now served by new Line 150.

line-description: Chatsworth Station - Studio City via Plummer-Coldwater Canyon
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Warner Center - Burbank Airport via Valley Circle-Saticoy St
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Silverlake - Hollywood via Hyperion-Fountain Aves
card-1:
• Line 175 is discontinued.
  • Line 175 segment between John Marshall High School and Sunset/ Vermont is replaced by new Line 182, with all-day, 7-days a week service from Rose Hill Transit Center to B Line (Red) Vermont/Sunset Station, including Fletcher Dr, Rowena Av and Franklin St.

line-description: Highland Park - Montebello via Mission-Tyler-Rush
card-1:
• Line 176 is discontinued due to low ridership.
  • Alternative service from El Monte Station to The Shops of Montebello is provided by the new Line 287 via the existing Line 176 route.
  • Alternative services in the area between El Monte Station and Highland Park include Metro Lines 76, 78, 79, 258, 260, 266, 267, Metro Micro on-demand service as well as City of El Monte Commuter Shuttles and Montebello Bus Lines 20 and 30.

line-description: JPL - Pasadena (Caltech)
card-1: Line 177 service is restored for weekday peak periods between Pasadena (Caltech) and Jet Propulsion Laboratory. This service had been suspended in April 2020 due to the pandemic.

line-description: Hollywood - Glendale - Pasadena via Los Feliz-Colorado
card-1:
• Lines 180, 181 and 780 merged to become the new frequent Line 180, operating on the same route as discontinued Line 780 from Pasadena City College to Hollywood/Vine via Brand Bl instead of Central Av in downtown Glendale.
  • Line 81 changes route via Yosemite Dr and Eagle Rock Bl to replace discontinued Line 181 segment.
  • Pasadena Transit Line 20 and new Metro Line 662 replace Line 180 on Lake Av.
  • Foothill Transit Line 187 replaces discontinued Line 181 service on Colorado Bl east of Pasadena City College.

line-description: Hollywood - Glendale - Pasadena via Los Feliz-Colorado
card-1:
• Lines 181 merged into the new frequent Line 180, operating on the same route as discontinued Line 780 from Pasadena City College to Hollywood/Vine via Brand Bl instead of Central Av in downtown Glendale.
  • Line 81 changes route via Yosemite Dr and Eagle Rock Bl to replace discontinued Line 181 segment.
  • Pasadena Transit Line 20 and new Metro Line 662 replace Line 180 on Lake Av.
  • Foothill Transit Line 187 replaces discontinued Line 181 service on Colorado Bl east of Pasadena City College.

line-description: NorthEast LA - East Hollywood
card-2:
• New Line 182 operates all-day, 7 days a week, from Rose Hill Transit Center to B Line (Red) Vermont/Sunset Station via Mercury Av, Griffin Av (replaces discontinued Line 252), Figueroa St, York Bl (replaces discontinued Line 83), Eagle Rock Bl, Fletcher Dr, Rowena Av, and Franklin St (replaces discontinued Line 175), to provide more direct east-west connection between Northeast LA and Hollywood.
  • Service continues between John Marshall High School and Vermont/Sunset Station.

line-description: Sherman Oaks - Glendale via Magnolia Bl
card-1:
• Line 183 is discontinued.
  • Line 155 is extended from Sepulveda Bl to replace the Line 183 segment on Magnolia Bl to the B Line (Red) North Hollywood Station.
  • Line 94 provides more frequency on the segment of Line 183 east of North Hollywood Station along Magnolia Bl to downtown Burbank.
  • Metro Micro on-demand service and Glendale Beeline 4 available in Glendale to replace the Line 183 segment on Chevy Chase/Acacia/Verdugo.
  • Metro Micro also serves the Bel Aire Dr/Kenneth Rd section of Line 183 in Burbank.

line-description: Echo Park - Exposition Park via Alvarado St-Hoover St
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Glendale - Koreatown via Silverlake Bl
card-1:
• Line 201 is discontinued due to low ridership.
  • Alternative services include Lines 92, 94, 180, 603, Glendale Beeline 4; Metro Micro transit on-demand service is available along Chevy Chase in the Glendale area and service to Glendale Adventist Hospital.

line-description: Willowbrook - Compton - Del Amo Station
card-2:
• The Line 202 segment south of the A Line Del Amo Station to Wilmington via Alameda St, Sanford St, and Anaheim St is discontinued due to low ridership.
  • Alternative services in the area include Metro Lines 232 (Anaheim St), 246 (Avalon Bl), LADOT DASH Wilmington, Long Beach Transit Line 52 and Lines 191/192 south of A Line Del Amo Station.
card-3:
• Service is expanded to operate weekdays all day, with new weekday off-peak service via existing route between the A Line (Blue) Del Amo Station and the C Line (Green)/A Line Willowbrook/Rosa Parks Station.
  • More weekday trips.

line-description: Hollywood - Athens via Vermont Av
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Willowbrook Station - San Pedro via Wilmington Av-Vermont Av
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Hollywood - Athens via Normandie Av
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Hollywood - Athens via Western Av
card-2:
• Selected weekday trips extended to the C Line (Green) Crenshaw Station replacing Line 757.
  • Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: Expo/Crenshaw Station - Crenshaw C Line (Green) Station via Van Ness Av-Arlington Av
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Hollywood/Vine Station - South Bay Galleria via Vine St, Wilshire/Western Station, Crenshaw Bl
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Inglewood-South Bay Galleria via Prairie Av-Inglewood Av
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Inglewood-South Bay Galleria via Prairie Av-Inglewood Av
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Hollywood/Vine Station - Hawthorne/Lennox Station via La Brea Av
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Hollywood/Vine Station - La Cienega Station via Hollywood Bl-Fairfax Av
card-2: Line 217 is extending east via Hollywood Bl to Hollywood/Vermont to help replace Line 780.
card-3:
• More frequent service between La Cienega/Jefferson Station and Hollywood/Vine via Fairfax Av and Hollywood Bl.
  • More weekday and weekend trips.

line-description: Studio City - Cedars Sinai Medical Center via Laurel Canyon Bl-Fairfax Bl
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Hollywood Burbank Airport - Hollywood via Hollywood Wy-Riverside Dr-Cahuenga Bl
card-2:
• Operates on Hollywood Way and Riverside Dr between Hollywood Burbank Airport and B Line (Red) Universal City/Studio City Station, then serves Cahuenga Bl south to Hollywood. This replaces Line 237 service on Cahuenga Bl to Hollywood, but will no longer serve the Barham Bl segment due to low ridership.
  • New Line 90 replaces Line 222 north of Hollywood Burbank Airport to Sunland.

line-description: Sylmar Station - Universal City Station via San Fernando Rd-Lankershim Bl
card-1: New Line 690 replaces Line 224 between Sylmar/San Fernando Station and Olive View Medical Center.
card-3:
• More weekday and weekend trips.
  • Line 224 operates frequent service along the existing route via Lankershim Bl and San Fernando Rd between B Line (Red) Universal City/Studio City Station, North Hollywood Station, and Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station.

line-description: Mission College - Studio City via Laurel Canyon Bl
card-2: Operates via normal route between Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station and Studio City via Laurel Canyon Bl and Hubbard St, with weekday service extending to LA Mission College via Hubbard St.

line-description: LAX City Bus Center - Long Beach - via Sepulveda Bl-Pacific Coast Hwy
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Lake View Terrace - Sherman Oaks via Van Nuys Bl (+ Westside Owl service)
card-2: Line 233 extends during overnight Owl hours 12am – 4am to the E Line (Expo) and Westside via Ventura and Sepulveda Blvds (in place of Line 234) when new Line 761 service is not operating.

line-description: Mission College - Sylmar Station - Sherman Oaks via Sepulveda Bl
card-2:
• Frequent service on Sepulveda Bl north of Ventura Bl to Sylmar/San Fernando Station (replacing Line 734).
  • Selected trips extend to Mission College.
  • Route segment south of Ventura Bl to the Westside and E Line (Expo) will be replaced by Line 761 daytime and evening hours seven days a week, and overnight Owl service is replaced by Line 233.
  • Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: Sylmar Station - Encino via Balboa Bl
card-2:
• Operates normal route via Balboa Bl between Ventura Bl and Rinaldi St.
  • Travels to Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station via former Line 239 route.
  • Line 236 route segment north of Rinaldi St is discontinued due to low ridership.

line-description: Encino-Granada Hill-Mission Hills-North Hollywood via White Oak Av-Woodley Av-Chandler
card-1:
• Line 237 and 239 merge to become the new Line 237 between North Hollywood Station, Granada Hills, and Encino.
  • B Line (Red) replaces Line 237 service between North Hollywood Station and Hollywood.
  • Line 222 also serves Cahuenga Bl between Universal City and Hollywood.
  • Line 236 replaces Line 239 between Balboa Bl and Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station.
card-2:
• Line 237 follows normal route from North Hollywood Station via Chandler Bl, Burbank Bl, Victory Bl, and Woodley Av to Rinaldi St.
  • Follows a new route via Balboa Bl, Chatsworth St, and the former Line 239 route via Zelzah Av, Lindley Av, Roscoe Bl, White Oak Av to Encino (Ventura Bl).
card-3: New weekend service is added for segment on Zelzah Av, Lindley Av, Roscoe Bl, White Oak Av to Encino (Ventura Bl).

line-description: Sylmar Station - Encino via White Oak Av-Zelzah Av
card-1:
• Line 239 merged into the new Line 237 between North Hollywood Station, Granada Hills and Encino. Line 237 follows normal route from North Hollywood Station via Chandler Bl, Burbank Bl, Victory Bl, and Woodley Av to Rinaldi St, then a new route via Balboa Bl, Chatsworth St, and the former Line 239 route via Zelzah Av, Lindley Av, Roscoe Bl, White Oak Av to Encino (Ventura Bl).
  • B Line (Red) service replaces Line 237 between North Hollywood Station and Hollywood.
  • Line 222 also serves Cahuenga Bl between Universal City and Hollywood.
  • Line 236 replaces Line 239 between Balboa Bl and Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station.
card-3: New weekend service is added for segment on Zelzah Av, Lindley Av, Roscoe Bl, White Oak Av to Encino (Ventura Bl).

line-description: Northridge - Universal City Station via Reseda Bl-Ventura Bl
card-1:
• Lines 150, 240, 245, 744 and 750 merge to become new Lines 150 and 240.
  • The new Line 240 operates via Reseda Bl and east along Ventura Bl between Northridge (Devonshire St), CSUN campus, and B Line (Red) Universal City/Studio City Station.
  • Line 240 via Reseda and Ventura Blvds replaces Lines 150, 744 and 750 on Ventura Bl east of Ventura/Reseda and replaces Line 744 on Reseda Bl.
  • The new Line 150 operates from Ventura/Reseda west to Chatsworth Station along Ventura Bl and Topanga Canyon Bl.
  • New Line 150 replaces existing Line 245 on Topanga Canyon Bl.
card-2: Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: Porter Ranch - Woodland Hills via Tampa Av-Winnetka Av
card-2: No route changes.
card-3: More weekday and Saturday trips. Restored Saturday service.

line-description: Porter Ranch - Woodland Hills via Tampa Av-Winnetka Av
card-2: No route changes.
card-3: More weekday and Saturday trips. Restored Saturday service.

line-description: Chatsworth Station - Ventura Bl via De Soto Av
card-2:
• Line 244 operates as a separate line (no longer linked to Line 245) via normal route on De Soto Av between Chatsworth Station and Ventura Bl.
  • New Line 150 replaces Lines 244 and 245, with service on Ventura Bl and Topanga Canyon Bl between Reseda Bl and Chatsworth Station.
  • Line 245 is replaced by new Line 150 operating from Ventura/Reseda west to Chatsworth Station along Ventura Bl and Topanga Canyon Bl.
card-3: More weekday and weekend trips. New weekend service.

line-description: Chatsworth Station - Ventura Bl via Topanga Canyon Bl
card-1:
• Line 244 operates as a separate line (no longer linked to Line 245) via normal route via De Soto Av between Chatsworth Station and Ventura Bl.
  • New Line 150 replaces existing Lines 244 and 245, with service on Ventura Bl and Topanga Canyon Bl between Reseda Bl and Chatsworth Station.
  • Line 245 is replaced by new Line 150 which operates from Ventura/Reseda west to Chatsworth Station along Ventura Bl and Topanga Canyon Bl.

line-description: San Pedro - Harbor Gateway Transit Center via Avalon Bl
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Eagle Rock - Cypress Park - Long Beach Blvd C Line (Green) Station via Eagle Rock Bl-Soto St
card-2: Line 251 extends trips every 30 minutes weekdays and weekends via Line 28 route on Cypress Av and Eagle Rock Bl to Eagle Rock (Colorado Bl/Eagledale).

line-description: Lincoln Heights - Boyle Heights via Soto St
card-1:
• Line 252 is discontinued due to low ridership.
  • Alternative bus service includes Line 81 (Figueroa St), new Line 182 (Griffin Av/Broadway/Lincoln Park/Sierra/Mercury Av), Line 251 (Soto St), LADOT DASH service El Sereno/City Terrace.

line-description: Commerce - Sierra Madre Villa Station via Eastern Ave-Ave 64-Washington Bl
card-2:
• Line 256 between Commerce and Highland Park follows normal route.
  • The segment between Highland Park and Pasadena changes to operate via Avenue 64, Colorado Bl, L Line (Gold) Memorial Park Station, Lincoln Av, Washington Bl, Altadena Dr and Foothill Bl to terminate at the L Line (Gold) Sierra Madre Villa Station.

line-description: Highland Park/South Pasadena - Paramount via Fremont Av-Eastern Av
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Altadena - Artesia Station via Fair Oaks Av-Atlantic Bl
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Pasadena - Altadena - City of Hope - El Monte Station
card-1:
• Line 264 is discontinued due to low ridership.
  • New Metro Micro on-demand provides alternate transit service in Altadena, Pasadena and Sierra Madre. Service to the City of Hope Medical Center is provided by the L Line (Gold).

line-description: Pico Rivera - Lakewood Center Mall via Paramount Bl
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Sierra Madre Villa Station - Lakewood Center Mall via RosemeadBl
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Pasadena - El Monte Station via Del Mar Bl & Temple City Bl
card-2:
• Line 267 is shortened to operate via normal route between El Monte Station, Arcadia and Pasadena via Temple City Bl, Rosemead Bl and Del Mar Bl, ending at the L Line (Gold) Del Mar Station.
  • New Line 256 operates via the south end of Lincoln Av, and new Line 662 operates in both directions on a loop route via Lake Av, Altadena Dr, Lincoln Av, Washington Bl, and Los Robles Av between Pasadena L Line (Gold) Del Mar and Lake Stations, and Altadena on weekdays and weekends.
  • New Metro Micro transit on-demand service is available in Sierra Madre, Altadena, JPL and Pasadena.

line-description: Sierra Madre Villa Station - El Monte Station via Baldwin Av
card-2:
• Line 268 is shortened to operate from the El Monte Station to the L Line (Gold) Sierra Madre Villa Station, providing direct service on Foothill Bl and no longer travels along Sierra Madre Bl via Baldwin Av and Michillinda Av.
  • New Line 256 serves Washington Bl/Lincoln Av.
  • New Metro Micro transit on-demand service is available in Sierra Madre, Altadena and Pasadena, and to JPL.

line-description: El Monte Station - Arcadia Station via Santa Anita Av
card-2:
• New Line 287 replaces Line 487 between El Monte Station and Arcadia Station via Santa Anita Av, with weekday and weekend service.
  • On weekdays only, Line 287 extends from El Monte Station to The Shops at Montebello via the Line 176 route.

line-description: Burbank Station - Sylmar Station via San Fernando Rd
card-2: New Line 294 operates on San Fernando Rd between Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station and downtown Burbank, replacing Lines 94 and 794.

line-description: Harbor Gateway Transit Center - Palos Verdes via Hawthorne Bl
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Downtown LA - Disneyland via Harbor Transitway-105 Freeway-Norwalk C Line (Green) Station
card-2:
• No route changes.
  • Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: Downtown LA - Sierra Madre Villa Station
card-2:
• Line 487 operates from L Line (Gold) Sierra Madre Villa Station and proceeds via San Gabriel Bl, Las Tunas Dr, Mission Dr, Del Mar Av, I-10 Express Lanes to 7th St Metro Center in downtown LA during weekday peak hours, and LA Union Station during off-peak weekdays and all day weekends.
  • A segment of Line 487 in Sierra Madre is replaced with new Metro Micro transit on-demand service, which serves Sierra Madre, Pasadena and Altadena.
  • New Line 287 replaces Line 487 between El Monte Station and Arcadia Station via Santa Anita Av, with weekday and weekend service.

line-description: Downtown LA - Temple City
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: North Hollywood - Pasadena Express
card-2: Line 501 continues to link North Hollywood, Burbank, Glendale and Pasadena, with a new route serving downtown Glendale via Brand Bl and Broadway.

line-description: Malibu - Santa Monica
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Jefferson Park - San Pedro via Harbor Transitway
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: El Monte Station - Long Beach VA Medical Center via I-605 Freeway
card-2: Line 577 between El Monte Station and Cal State Long Beach via I-605 route change between El Monte Station and Rio Hondo College via I-605 and I-10 freeways instead of Santa Anita Av & Peck Rd. Service to Los Cerritos Center is discontinued due to low ridership, providing faster, more direct service to/from Cal State Long Beach and Long Beach VA Medical Center.

line-description: Warner Center Circulator
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Westwood - Pacific Palisades via Sunset Bl
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Glendale - Grand Station via San Fernando Rd-Rampart St-Hoover St
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: LAC+USC Medical Center - Boyle Heights Shuttle
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Huntington Park Shuttle
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Beverly Dr-Burton Wy-Robertson Bl Shuttle
card-2: New Line 617 operates from the E Line (Expo) Culver City Station to Cedars-Sinai Medical Center/Beverly Center via Robertson Bl (replaces Line 17), then west on Burton Way (replaces Line 16), and south on Beverly Dr to Pico Bl (replaces Line 14).
card-3: More weekday and weekend trips. New weekend service for Robertson Bl.

line-description: Mission Hills-Hollywood Owl via Woodley-Chandler-Cahuenga
card-2: No route changes to Line 656 overnight Owl service.

line-description: Altadena-Pasadena Shuttle
card-2:
• Operates in both directions on a loop route via Lake Av, Altadena Dr, Lincoln Av, Washington Bl, and Los Robles Av between Pasadena (L Line [Gold] Del Mar and Lake Stations) and Altadena weekdays and weekends.
  • Line 662 replaces Line 687 and parts of Lines 180, 267 and 268.

line-description: Cal State LA - City Terrace Shuttle
card-1: Line 665 continues to link Cal State LA and Indiana/Olympic with weekday 5:30am and Saturday 6am service start times restored.
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Glendale College - Glassell Park via Verdugo Rd
card-1:
• Line 685 is discontinued due to low ridership.
  • Alternative bus service to Glendale College provided by Line 90 (Glendale Av). Metro Micro transit on-demand service is available in Glendale, Eagle Rock and Highland Park.

line-description: Altadena - Pasadena via Allen Av
card-1:
Line 686 no longer operates south to the L Line (Gold) Fillmore Station due to low ridership.
  • Line 687 is discontinued due to low ridership. Alternative bus service includes frequent Lines 260 (Fair Oaks Av), new Line 662 (Washington Bl, Los Robles Av and Lake Av). Metro Micro transit on-demand service is available in Altadena and Pasadena.
card-2: Line 686 continues to operate between Altadena (New York Dr/Allen Av) and L Line (Gold) Del Mar Station.

line-description: Altadena - Pasadena via Los Robles Av
card-1:
• Line 687 is discontinued due to low ridership. Alternative bus service includes frequent Lines 260 (Fair Oaks Av), new Line 662 (Washington Bl, Los Robles Av and Lake Av).
  • Metro Micro transit on-demand service is available in Altadena and Pasadena.
  • Line 686 continues to operate between Altadena (New York Dr/Allen Av) and L Line (Gold) Del Mar Station, but no longer extends south to the L Line (Gold) Fillmore Station due to low ridership.

line-description: Sunland-Sylmar
card-2:
• New Line 690 operates between Sunland and Olive View Medical Center via Foothill Bl, replacing Lines 90/91.
  • Operates on Roxford St and San Fernando Rd to Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station, replacing Line 224.

line-description: Downtown LA - Santa Monica via Santa Monica Bl
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Santa Monica - Downtown LA via Wilshire Bl
card-2:
• Line 720 continues to operate between downtown LA (6th & Central) and Westwood/Santa Monica via normal route on Wilshire Bl.
  • Line 720 east of downtown LA is replaced by Line 18 increased service on Whittier Bl between downtown LA and Commerce Center.

line-description: Downtown LA - Santa Monica via Venice Bl
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Sylmar - West Los Angeles via Sepulveda Bl
card-1:
• Line 734 is discontinued.
  • On Sepulveda Bl in the San Fernando Valley, Line 234 replaces with increased service.
  • New Line 761 links the San Fernando Valley and the Westside and E Line (Expo).

line-description: Northridge - Pacoima via Van Nuys-Ventura-Reseda Bl
card-1:
• Line 744 is discontinued.
  • Replaced by Line 240 increased service on Reseda and Ventura Bl, and Line 233 increased service plus new Line 761 on Van Nuys Bl.

line-description: Warner Center - Universal/Studio City via Ventura Bl
card-1:
• Lines 150, 240, 245, 744 and 750 merge to become two new lines: Line 150 operates from Ventura/Reseda west to Chatsworth Station along Ventura Bl and Topanga Canyon Bl; Line 240 operates via Reseda Bl and east along Ventura Bl between Northridge (Devonshire St), CSUN campus, and B Line (Red) Universal City Station.
  • New Line 150 replaces existing Line 245 on Topanga Canyon Bl while new Line 240 via Reseda and Ventura Bl replace Lines 150, 744 and 750 on Ventura Bl east of Ventura/Reseda and replace Line 744 on Reseda Bl.

line-description: Hollywood - Athens via Vermont Ave
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: Hollywood - Crenshaw Station via Western Ave
card-1:
• Line 757 weekday service is discontinued.
  • Line 207 replaces with more frequent service on Western Av.
  • Selected Line 207 trips are extended to C Line (Green) Crenshaw Station.

line-description: Sylmar Station - Westside/Expo Line via Van Nuys Bl-Sepulveda Bl
card-1:
• New Line 761 replaces Lines 734, 744 and 788.
  • Operates between Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station and E Line (Expo) Expo/Sepulveda Station, to serve high travel demand between San Fernando Valley and the Westside, via Van Nuys Bl, Ventura Bl and Sepulveda Bl.

line-description: Downtown LA - El Monte Station via Garvey Av-Atlantic Bl-Cesar Chavez Av
card-1:
• Line 770 is discontinued.
  • Replaced by frequent Line 70, rerouted via Garvey Av, Atlantic Bl and Cesar Chavez Av between El Monte Station and downtown LA.

line-description: Pasadena - Washington/Fairfax via Colorado Bl-Hollywood Bl-Fairfax Av
card-1:
• Line 780 is discontinued.
  • Replaced by Line 180 with more frequent service between Pasadena City College and Hollywood/Vine; Line 217 with more frequent service on Hollywood Bl and Fairfax Av to the E Line (Expo), and extended east along Hollywood Bl from Hollywood/Vine to Vermont/Sunset.

line-description: Van Nuys Bl - Westside
card-1:
• Line 788 is discontinued.
  • Replaced by new Line 761 service between Sylmar/San Fernando Metrolink Station, Van Nuys Bl, the Westside and E Line (Expo) Expo/Sepulveda Station, with seven-day service.

line-description: Downtown LA - Sylmar Station via San Fernando Rd
card-1:
• Lines 794 merges into Line 94, with more frequent service on San Fernando Rd via most of the existing Line 94 route between downtown LA and downtown Burbank.
  • A change in route operated by Line 94 will be through downtown Glendale via Brand Bl and Broadway (instead of direct via San Fernando Rd).
  • Line 94 adds a new extension via Magnolia Bl between Burbank and B Line (Red) North Hollywood Station, replacing a segment of Line 183.
  • New Line 294 operates on San Fernando Rd between Sylmar San Fernando Metrolink Station and downtown Burbank in place of Lines 94 and 794.
card-2: Some bus stops on line have been removed to improve travel times.

line-description: Chatsworth - Canoga Park - North Hollywood
card-2: No route changes. This line is now fully operated by battery electric buses.

line-description: San Pedro - Harbor Gateway Tranist Center - Downtown LA - El Monte Station
card-2: No route changes.

line-description: San Pedro - Harbor Gateway Tranist Center - Downtown LA - El Monte Station
card-2: No route changes.
